newsitem.title: Australia: Australian debt awaits RBA decision, GDP data.
newsitem.headline: Australian debt awaits RBA decision, GDP data.

text.p: *Australian debt futures were firm, albeit below the heady levels seen in after hours trading, as the market pondered the outside chance of a further easing by the RBA.
June bill futures ended SYCOM at 92.65, equating to a cash rate of of 5.35 percent, while September bills touched 94.69, a near 20 basis point discount to cash.

"There are still some desperados looking for a cut. But I think 9.30 will just come and go, and put the immediate focus on GDP. I will be totally shocked if they go again," said one bond trader. The central bank announces any changes to monetary policy at 9.30 a.m. (2330 GMT).
First quarter GDP is due at 11.30 a.m. (0130 GMT) with forecasts centring on a quarterly 0.8 percent rise.

Spread margins were fairly mixed against the dollar bloc with the long end slightly lagging a rally in U.S. Treasuries on Tuesday, where hopes remain for slowing growth in the second quarter. However, the market outperformed Canadian debt in the aftermath of Tuesday's Canadian election.
